text: Hi All,What do you guys put at achievement part?Basically, I'm just a junior executive with nothing much to boast. However, I believe I have done my part well because I constantly get complimented by my superiors.1) Customer Service - Appraisal -7/10- Frequently received compliments from customers. - Received compliments from HOD- Had loyal customers that would look for me instead of other CS agents when they had issues- Bosses from other dept wanted me to be transferred to their dept when I couldn't stand CS job anymore2) Marketing - Appraisal - 8/10- Frequently complimented by HOD/GM- Received compliments from clients- Received the most certificates for 'syok-sendiri' programme organised by my companyDespite all these, i have nothing to boast like what I see on internet how they have helped company earned xxxx money, successfully organised a project and yada yada. Besides that, is it ok for the resume to be 4 pages long?Kindly advise, thanks.PS: I know there's a thread to discuss about this topic but I'm posting here because there are more active members here.

it will be good if you elobrate more in your jobscope. instead of put (example) - liaise with customer.. but in a good way you can put as (Greet customers and ascertain what each customer wants or needs.)
remove the complimented part, state your job task and list down the certificates for 'syok-sendiri' programme organised
Well, I received 13 certificates in total and some of it are anger management, grammar courses which aren't relevant. Can these be listed?
Yep, this is what I did and as a result, my resume is in 4 pages long

yeah, those are what you have learn and recorded black and white, while the compliment are just verbal compliment unless ur company got give ur certificate for every time you complimented by customer/boss. interviewer prefer see something black and white. u can put only the 1 that related to your new job but u never know that other might help too
True, that's the reason why I said that I have nothing to put under achievement. My company doesn't have best employee certificate such thing.
yah, so just put the cert, it also consider your archivement
4 pages are too long imo...keep it at 2 pages

No employer is going to have the time and patience to read through 4 pages. Unless you are someone with over 10 years experience, 1-2 page is pretty normal.If you really have nothing to put under achievements, then just don't include that section. Nothing is worse than putting unrelated points that the employer won't care about.
it ok 4 page long.. each of my job is discribe for 4 page.. and each time interview.. the HR(mnc) really goes thru it one by one to understand.. unless you apply for gov/small company..
Not ok. U think ure still uni kids to include those stuff?And resume 2 pages enough.
